u8 applProcessCmd (u8 const *rxData, const u8 rxSize, u8 *txData, u8 *txSize)
 Process application commands received from the GUI via USB.

Detailed Description

This module implements a callback (applProcessCmd()) for the AMS base firmware layer. This callback is called any time a firmware specific USB command is received. The callback is implemented as a dispatcher which identifies the command send by the GUI, extracts any additional parameter and then executes that command or calls a function which implements that command.

Function Documentation

u8 applProcessCmd ( u8 const *  rxData,
const u8  rxSize,
u8 *  txData,
u8 *  txSize 
)
Note:
This function is called by the USB stack when a command of type applicaiton command is received via USB.
Parameters:
[in]rxDataApplication command data received from the GUI.
[in]rxSizeLength of the application command data in bytes.
[out]txDataSet to the data which shall be send back to the GUI as response.
[out]txSizeNumber of bytes stored in txData as response for the GUI.
Returns:
ERR_PARAM: Data contained in rxData is invalid.
ERR_NONE: No Error, eventual response data is available in txData.

Note:
